meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Renowned Editor Dies William Maxwell, who, in 40 years as an editor with The New Yorker worked with the likes of John Updike, John Cheever and Eudora Welty and wrote novels and short stories himself, was 91.

Renowned Editor Dies William Maxwell, who, in 40 years as an editor with The New Yorker worked with the likes of John Updike, John Cheever and Eudora Welty and wrote novels and short stories himself, was 91.

Newspaper Deal in Canada In a bet on the future braiding of television, newspapers and the Internet, Canada's second-largest private TV network is buying about half of that country's larger daily newspapers from the press baron Conrad Black, for $2.36 billion.

A Colony of Interloping Ants Argentine ants are overwhelming native California ants while forming what scientists call a supercolony, stretching hundreds of miles from San Diego to north of San Francisco.
